content: Yes, financial advisors can advise on tax implications associated with estate planning. In many cases, estate planning can help minimize tax liabilities and maximize the value of an individual's estate for their heirs. Financial advisors can help clients understand the tax implications of various estate planning strategies, such as setting up a trust or establishing a gifting program. They can also provide guidance on how to structure and allocate assets in a way that minimizes tax liabilities. It is important to consult with a knowledgeable financial advisor or tax professional to ensure that your estate plan is set up in a tax-efficient manner.
